intro: Psychotria anthocleistifolia, commonly known as the "Amazonian psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its fruit is a capsule that contains numerous tiny seeds. Psychotria anthocleistifolia is often found in shaded, moist forest understories and plays a role in local ecosystems.
